item.title: Exclusive - Canadian energy firms at bigger risk from cyber, bomb attacks - spy agency
Will TransCanada Corporation Raise Its Dividend in 2017?
Review process for Energy East pipeline faces legal challenge
item.description: [Reuters] - A Canadian environmental group on Tuesday filed a legal challenge against the regulatory review of TransCanada Corp's Energy East pipeline, seeking to restart what it calls a process tainted by bias. Transition Initiative Kenora's motion to be filed to the National Energy Board quasi-judicial body comes one day after the board formally assigned three replacement members for Energy East's review. Transition Initiative Kenora said it should restart as the meeting with the consultant calls into question any previous decision by the panel.

item.title: Review process for Energy East pipeline to face legal challenge
item.description: [Reuters] - A Canadian environmental group on Tuesday will file a legal challenge against the regulatory review of TransCanada Corp's Energy East pipeline, it said, seeking to restart what it calls a process tainted by bias. Transition Initiative Kenora's motion to be filed to the National Energy Board quasi-judicial body comes one day after the board formally assigned three replacement members for Energy East's review. Transition Initiative Kenora said it should restart as the meeting with the consultant calls into question any previous decision by the panel.

Energy East pipeline woes cast pall over Canada's Atlantic coast
item.description: [Reuters] - For years, heavy equipment operator Ashley Underhill has tried to defy the notion that one could only make a good living in Canada's poorer east coast by spending most of the time away from the family in the nation's western oil patch. One reason Underhill had battled on, working on small private contracts, including snow clearing and wood cutting, was Energy East, a planned 4,600-km (2860-mile) pipeline between Alberta's oil sands and the east coast and the promise of an economic boost it could bring.

Siim A. Vanaselja Designated as Next TransCanada Chair
item.description: [Marketwired] - CALGARY, ALBERTA--(Marketwired - Dec 8, 2016) - News Release - TransCanada Corporation (TRP) (TRP) (TransCanada) announced today that Siim A. Vanaselja has been designated as the next chair of the TransCanada board. Mr. Vanaselja will succeed S. Barry Jackson, who will retire as chair of the board at the close of TransCanada's annual meeting of shareholders in 2017. Mr. Vanaselja's appointment is subject to his re-election by TransCanada's shareholders at TransCanada's annual general meeting of shareholders in 2017.
